text: Botswana competed at the 2019 African Games held from 19 to 31 August 2019 in Rabat, Morocco. In total 103 athletes represented Botswana at the games. Athletes representing Botswana won five gold medals, three silver medals and six bronze medals and the country finished in 13th place in the medal table. == Medal summary == === Medal table === | style="text-align:left; width:78%; vertical-align:top;"| {| class="wikitable sortable" style="font-size:95%" |- ! Amantle Montsho will also represent Botswana in athletics. Leungo Scotch won the men's 400 metres event and Galefele Moroko won the women's 400 metres event. == Boxing == Nine athletes were scheduled to compete in boxing. Boxers representing Botswana won two gold medals and one silver medal and the country finished 2nd in the boxing medal table. == Chess == Botswana is scheduled to compete in chess. Four chess players are scheduled to compete: Phemelo Khetho, Providence Oatlhotse, Onkemetse Linda Francis and Refilwe Tsutsu Gabatshwana. == Cycling == Botswana competed in events in both road cycling and mountain bike cycling. == Judo == Thato Lebang, Tirelo Lekoko, Edwin Sello, Letlhogile Tsheko, Gwafila Tema, Happy Taukobong, Victoria Leagajang and Lucky Mabaka will represent Botswana in judo. == Karate == Botswana competed in karate. In total athletes representing Botswana won four bronze medals. == Swimming == Six athletes represented Botswana in swimming. ;Men {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=3|Solomon Dzingai |align=left|50 m freestyle |26.40 |33 |colspan=2|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m freestyle |57.56 |27 |colspan=2|Did not advance |- |align=left|200 m freestyle |2:19.05 |16 |colspan=2|Did not advance |- |align=left rowspan=5|Ethan Fischer |align=left|50 m breaststroke |31.71 |21 |colspan=2|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m breaststroke |1:08.72 |15 |colspan=2|Did not advance |- |align=left|200 m breaststroke |2:36.13 |15 |colspan=2|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m butterfly |1:06.23 |28 |colspan=2|Did not advance |- |align=left|200 m individual medley |2:23.52 |10 |colspan=2|Did not advance |- |align=left rowspan=3|Kitso Matija |align=left|50 m freestyle |26.03 |32 |colspan=2|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m freestyle |55.60 |24 |colspan=2|Did not advance |- |align=left|50 m butterfly |27.77 |27 |colspan=2|Did not advance |- |align=left rowspan=5|Adrian Robinson |align=left|50 m breaststroke |28.97 |8 Q |28.88 |7 |- |align=left|100 m breaststroke |1:03.84 |8 Q |1:03.43 |7 |- |align=left|200 m breaststroke |2:35.91 |14 |colspan=2|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m butterfly |59.12 |22 |colspan=2|Did not advance |- |align=left|200 m individual medley |2:16.13 |8 Q |2:14.83 |8 |- |align=left|Kitso Matija Ethan Fischer Solomon Dzingai Adrian Robinson |align=left|4×100 m freestyle relay |colspan=2 |3:49.93 |7 |} ;Women {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; Two athletes represented Botswana: Karabo Kula and Wardell Ernest Samothsozo. Kula won the bronze medal in the women's –46 kg event. == Tennis == Denzel Seetso, Mark Nawa, Tshegofatso Tsiang and Ekua Refilwe Youri will represent Botswana in tennis. == Volleyball == In June 2019 Botswana women's national volleyball team competed in the women's tournament at the 2019 African Games. The men's team was also scheduled to compete but ultimately did not compete. == Weightlifting == Botswana is scheduled to compete in weightlifting. Four athletes are scheduled to compete: Bokang Alphius Kagiso, Kgotla Alphius Kgaswane, Magdeline Moyengwa and Dikabelo Solomon. == See also == * Botswana at the African Games == References == Category:Nations at the 2019 African Games 2019 African Games
title: Botswana at the 2019 African Games
